N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 262.4 - Other methods of allocation

State Regulations

Tax Law, § 4(c) of § 1340(c); Codes and Ordinances of the

City of Yonkers, § 92-101(c)

The provisions of sections
262.1
through
262.3
of this Part are designed to apportion and allocate to the City of Yonkers, in
a fair and equitable manner, a nonresident taxpayer's portion of wages and net
earnings from self-employment attributable to a business, trade, profession or
occupation carried on partly within and partly without the City of Yonkers. Where the methods provided under those sections do not so allocate and
apportion such wages and net earnings from self-employment, the State Tax

Commission may require a nonresident taxpayer to apportion and allocate wages
and net earnings from self-employment under such method as it prescribes, as
long as the prescribed method results in a fair and equitable apportionment and
allocation. A nonresident may submit an alternative method of apportionment and
allocation with respect to the portion of wages and net earnings from
self-employment attributable to a business, trade, profession or occupation
carried on partly within and partly without the City of Yonkers. The proposed
method must be fully explained in the taxpayer's City of Yonkers earnings tax
return. If the method proposed by the taxpayer is approved by the State Tax

Commission, it may be used in lieu of the applicable method under sections
262.1
through
262.3
of this Part. Notes
